subject: RE: [junit] How to record test results in XML format
msgSnippet: Hi, I put optional.jar in my CLASSPATH. Still it gives the same problem. Regrads, Syed. ... location= /vobs/autotest/portal_kernel/lib/junit.jar ...
messageBody:
Hi,

I put optional.jar in my CLASSPATH. Still it gives the
same problem.

Regrads,
Syed.


--- Jason Rogers <jacaetevha@...> wrote:
> O.K. anyone else feel free to jump in... (thanks
> J.B.)
>
> try putting optional.jar on your CLASSPATH as
> well...
>
> It generally isn't this hard.
>
> BTW: I thought JBungler had an Ant integration
> module.
>
> =jason
>
> On Wed, 2002-07-10 at 15:51, syed Anwaruddin wrote:
> Hi,
> Thanks for the immediate reply!!!
>
> I have been trying this since yesterday without any
> break through...
>
> I modified my build.xml file. Following below is the
> snippet:
> <project name="Autotest" default="run">
> <!-- taskdef name="myrun"
> classname="com.proj.test.autotest.AutotestHarness"
> -->
> <!-- classpath -->
> <!-- pathelement
>
location="/vobs/autotest/portal_kernel/lib/junit.jar"
> /-->
> <!-- pathelement
>
location="/ausp3/jakarta-ant-1.4.1/lib/optional.jar"/-->
> <!-- /classpath -->
> <!-- taskdef -->
>
> <target name="run">
> <junit printsummary="true">
> <test
> name="com.proj.test.autotest.AutotestHarness"
> outfile="results" >
> <formatter type="xml" />
> </test>
> </junit>
> </target>
>
> </project>
>
> If I define the taskdef I am getting error as
> "com.proj.test.autotest.AutotestHarness" class not
> found. If I commented Out taskdef and use test tag I
> am getting "/users/test/build.xml:10: Could not
> create
> task of type: junit. Common solutions are to use
> taskdef to declare your task, or, if this is an
> optional task, to put the optional.jar in the lib
> directory of your ant installation (ANT_HOME)".
>
> Please help me in resolving this. I am new to ANT
> and
> did'nt know how to resolve it. I even copied
> junit.jar, src.jar to my AN_HOME/lib directory. Even
> this did'nt resolve the issue.
>
> Thanks in Advance!!!
> Syed.
>
>
>
>
> --- "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbr@...>
> wrote:
> > Impossible. The error can't happen if the
> <taskdef>
> > tag is commented
> > out. Either try again or tell us that line 2
> should
> > not be commented
> > out.
> >
> > Thanks.
> >
> > *********** REPLY SEPARATOR ***********
> >
> > On 2002-07-10 at 12:11 syed Anwaruddin wrote:
> >
> > >Hi All,
> > >
> > >I have optional.jar file in my ANT_HOME/lib
> > directory.
> > >
> > >I am getting the class not found. Following below
> > is
> > >the error message:
> > >
> > >error "/users/test/build.xml:2: taskdef class
> > >com.proj.test.autotest.AutotestHarness cannot be
> > found
> > >
> > >Here is my code snippet:
> > >
> > ><project name="Autotest" default="run">
> > > <!-- taskdef name="myrun"
> >
> >classname="com.proj.test.autotest.AutotestHarness"
> > -->
> > > <classpath>
> > > <pathelement
> >
>
>location="/vobs/autotest/portal_kernel/lib/junit.jar"
> > >/>
> > > <pathelement
> >
>
>location="/ausp3/jakarta-ant-1.4.1/lib/optional.jar"
> > >/>
> > > </classpath>
> > > </taskdef>
> > >
> > > <target name="run">
> > > <junit printsummary="true">
> > > <test
> > >name="com.proj.test.autotest.AutotestHarness"
> > >outfile="results">
> > > <formatter type="xml"
> > />
> > > </test>
> > > </junit>
> > > </target>
> > >
> > ></project>
> > >
> > >
> > >Please help me in resolving this issue.
> > >
> > >Note: I am using Jbuilder to build my class file
> > then
> > >I am using ANT to run the class and output the
> > result
> > >in XML format.
> > >
> > >Thanks in Advance!!!!
> > >
> > >Regards,
> > >Syed.
> > >
> > >
> > >
> > >--- "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbr@...>
> > >wrote:
> > >> Likely you do not have Ant's "optional.jar" in
> > the
> > >> CLASSPATH when
> > >> running Ant. Please refer to the Ant
> > documentation
> > >> for details.
> > >>
> > >> *********** REPLY SEPARATOR ***********
> > >>
> > >> On 2002-07-09 at 14:23 syed Anwaruddin wrote:
> > >>
> > >> >Hi Jason,
> > >> >
> > >> >Thanks for your help!!!!
> > >> >
> > >> >When I execute sample build.xml, I am getting
> > the
> > >> >following error:
> > >> >"Unexpected element "junit"
> > >> >
> > >> >Following below is the sample code:
> > >> ><project name="Autotest" default="test">
> > >> > <target name="run" />
> > >> > <junit printsummary="true" >
> > >> > <test
> > >> >name="com.test.tc.autotest.checkClass"
> > >> >outfile="results">
> > >> > <formatter type="xml" />
> > >> > </test>
> > >> > </junit>
> > >> >
> > >> ></project>
> > >> >
> > >> >Please let me know where I am wrong.
> > >> >
> > >> >Thanks & Regards,
> > >> >Syed.
> > >> >
> > >> >
> > >> >
> > >> >--- Jason Rogers <jacaetevha@...>
> > wrote:
> > >> >> go to http://jakarta.apache.org/ant
> > >> >> download a binary (which includes
> > documentation)
> > >> >> set up your build script (read the
> > documentation)
> > >> >> run it (read the documentation)
> > >> >>
> > >> >> A simple build script may be (you'll want to
> > >> replace
> > >> >> all the hardcoded
> > >> >> paths to properties):
>
